title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.21 | 15-11-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So there is no trace of a tinge of materiality in this person.
segments.summary: The Lord is completely pure and free from material contamination, unlike us who are influenced by the illusory energy, leading to a material conception of self and the world.

segments.key_quote: We have to rise above tamas guna, rajas guna and sattva guna, and come to the plane of transcendence.
segments.summary: To see the Lord, one must transcend the three modes of material nature (goodness, passion, and ignorance) and reach the spiritual platform.

segments.key_quote: The deity form is completely a spiritual form, though it appears like a material form.
segments.summary: Deity worship in the temple is a transcendental practice, superior to other forms of spiritual practice, especially in Kali Yuga, because the Lord manifests in the deity form out of His causeless mercy.

segments.key_quote: Simply accept the process of bhakti yoga and don't ever even attempt any other form of yoga. It's not going to be successful.
segments.summary: Bhakti yoga, especially archana (deity worship) and kirtana (glorification), is the recommended path for spiritual progress, and pure devotees like Narada Muni can transform any place into Vaikuntha by their presence.
